meanings.definition: Involving more than two parties or countries.
meanings.sent1: The multilaterally agreed upon treaty was signed by several nations.
meanings.sent2: The United Nations promotes multilaterally beneficial agreements.
meanings.sent3: The multilaterally organized picnic had food from different countries.
meanings.sent4: Her wardrobe was a multilaterally sourced collection of international fashion.
meanings.sent5: The multilaterally decorated room showcased diverse cultural influences.

meanings.definition: In a manner involving more than two parties or countries.
meanings.sent1: The trade agreement was negotiated multilaterally to ensure fairness.
meanings.sent2: They decided to resolve the conflict multilaterally through diplomacy.
meanings.sent3: The party was planned multilaterally, with guests from various nations.
meanings.sent4: She communicated multilaterally, considering the perspectives of all involved.
meanings.sent5: The project was executed multilaterally, with contributions from multiple countries.
